title: Improving Semantics In Mobile Devices Profiling: A Model Conceptual Formalisation and Ontology Specification

This work is motivated by the lack of semantic in existing profiling methods and is part of a broaden framework for visualisation of intelligent planning information in collaborative environments.\ud
In this paper, before the discussion of this new model, its knowledge representation\ud
and ontology specification concepts, we argue about problems in existing profiling methods

The University of Edinburgh and research sponsors are authorised to reproduce and distribute reprints and on-line copies for their purposes notwithstanding any copyright annotation hereon.  The views and conclusions contained herein are the author’s and shouldn’t be interpreted as necessarily representing the official policies or endorsements, either expressed or implied, of other parties.</dc:description><dc:description>
In this work we discuss and propose a new approach for semantic enhancement in mobile devices profiling. This work is motivated by the lack of semantic in existing profiling methods and is part of a broaden framework for visualisation of intelligent planning information in collaborative environments.\ud
In this paper, before the discussion of this new model, its knowledge representation\ud
and ontology specification concepts, we argue about problems in existing profiling methods.</dc:description><dc:date>
